stx.reactive.Stream<T>

type
class
defined in
stx.reactive.Reactive

Constructor

new(updater : Pulse<Dynamic> -> Propagation<T>, ?sources : Array<Stream<Dynamic>>)

Instance Variables

weaklyHeld(getWeaklyHeld,setWeaklyHeld) : Bool

Instance Methods

attachListener(dependent : Stream<Dynamic>) : Void

bind<Z>(k : T -> Stream<Z>) : Stream<Z>

parameters
k The bind function.
AKA flatMap. Binds each value to another stream, and returns a flattened stream.

blind(time : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
time The time to blind the stream to.
Blinds the event stream to events occurring less than the specified milliseconds together.

blindS(time : Signal<Int>) : Stream<T>

parameters
time The time to blind the stream to.
Blinds the event stream to events occurring the specified number of milliseconds together or less.

calm(time : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds.
Calms the stream. No event will be fired unless it occurs T milliseconds after the prior event.

calmS(time : Signal<Int>) : Stream<T>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds.
Calms the stream. No event will be get through unless it occurs T milliseconds or more before the following event.

constant<Z>(value : Z) : Stream<Z>

parameters
value The constant that every value will be mapped to.
Maps this stream to a stream of constant values.

delay(time : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
time Time in milliseconds as an Int
Delays this stream by the specified number of milliseconds.

delayS(time : Signal<Int>) : Stream<T>

parameters
time Time in milliseconds as a Signal
Delays this stream by the specified number of milliseconds.

drop(n : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
n The number to drop.
Drops the specified number of events from this stream. This method does not change the timestamps of events.

dropWhile(pred : T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Drops events for as long as the predicate returns true.

each(f : T -> Void) : Stream<T>

Calls the specified function for each event.

filter(pred : T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Filters this stream by the specified predicate.

filterRepeats(?optStart : T) : Stream<T>

parameters
optStart An optional start value.
Filters adjacent repeats.

filterRepeatsBy(?optStart : T, eq : T -> T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
optStart An optional start value.
eq An equality function.
Filters adjacent repeats.

filterWhile(pred : T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Accepts all elements until the predicate first returns false.

flatMap<Z>(mapper : T -> Stream<Z>) : Stream<Z>

parameters
mapper The mapper.
Flattens the result of mapping each value to another stream.

foreach(f : T -> Void) : Stream<T>

Calls the specified function for each event.

group() : Stream<Iterable<T>>

returns
An Stream of grouped elements
Groups Stream elements which are sent sequentially and are == to each other into iterables and returns these in a new stream

groupBy(eq : T -> T -> Bool) : Stream<Iterable<T>>

parameters
eq The comparison function that will be used fo evaluate the equality of the stream elements.
returns
An Stream of grouped elements
Groups Stream elements which are sent sequentially and which return true from the supplied comparison function into iterables and returns these in a new stream

map<Z>(mapper : T -> Z) : Stream<Z>

parameters
mapper The mapping function.
Maps this stream to another stream by using the specified function.

merge(that : Stream<T>) : Stream<T>

parameters
that The Stream with which to merge 'this' stream
Merges this stream and the specified stream.

partition(pred : T -> Bool) : stx.Tuple2<Stream<T>, Stream<T>>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Partitions the stream into two event streams, one for which the predicate is true, one for which the predicate is false.

partitionWhile(pred : T -> Bool) : stx.Tuple2<Stream<T>, Stream<T>>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Returns a tuple of takeWhile/dropWhile for the specified predicate.

removeListener(dependent : Stream<Dynamic>, ?isWeakReference : Bool) : Bool

scanl<Z>(initial : Z, folder : Z -> T -> Z) : Stream<Z>

parameters
initial The initial value.
folder The folding function.
A stream of values resulting from left folding.

scanlP(folder : T -> T -> T) : Stream<T>

Same as scanl, but without an initial value.

sendEvent(value : Dynamic) : Stream<T>

parameters
value The value to send.
Sends an event now. This function should not be used except to create "pure" streams.

sendEventTyped(value : T) : Stream<T>

parameters
value The value to send.
A typed version of sendEvent. Sends an event now. This function should not be used except to create "pure" streams.

sendLater(value : Dynamic) : Stream<T>

parameters
value The value to send.
Sends an event later, "as soon as possible".

sendLaterIn(value : Dynamic, millis : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
value The value to send.
millis The number of milliseconds to send it in. If this is 0, the event will be scheduled for "as soon as possible".
Sends an event later. This function should not be used except to create "pure" streams.

shift(n : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
n The number of events to shift by.
Shifts events forward in time by the specified number of events.

shiftWhile(pred : T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
pred The predicate.
Shifts events forward in time until the specified predicate returns false for an event.

shiftWith(elements : Iterable<T>) : Stream<T>

parameters
elements The elements to use in time shifting.
Shifts events forward in time by pulling from the specified iterable until it's exhausted, then streaming the delayed events.

snapshot<Z>(value : Signal<Z>) : Stream<Z>

parameters
value The value.
Maps this stream into a stream of values determined by "snapshotting" the value of the signal.

startsWith(init : T) : Signal<T>

parameters
init The initial value.
Creates a signal backed by this event stream, which starts with the specified value.

take(n : Int) : Stream<T>

parameters
n The number of values.
Returns a finite stream consisting of the first n elements of this stream.

takeWhile(filter : T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
n The number of values.
Returns a finite stream consisting of the first subset of this stream for which the filter returns true.

toArray() : Array<T>

Converts the stream to an array. Note: This array will grow continuously without bound unless clients remove elements from it.

unique(?eq : T -> T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
eq The Function used to check event equality
Creates a new Stream in which only unique events taking place at unique timesteps will appear

uniqueEvents(?eq : T -> T -> Bool) : Stream<T>

parameters
eq The Function used to check event equality
Creates a new Stream in which only new events will appear (including those on the same time step)

uniqueSteps() : Stream<T>

Creates a new Stream in which only events on different time steps will appear

whenFinishedDo(f : Void -> Void) : Void

Invokes the specified function when this stream is "finished", defined as being unable to produce any more events.

zip<A>(as : Stream<A>) : Stream<stx.Tuple2<T, A>>

parameters
as The stream with which to zip 'this'.
returns
A Tuple slice containing an element from each stream
Zips elements of supplied streams together and returns an Stream of Tuple2 containing the zipped elements. 1, 2, 3.zip1, 2, 3 == Tuple2[1, 1], Tuple2[2, 2], Tuple2[3, 3]

zip3<A, B>(as : Stream<A>, bs : Stream<B>) : Stream<stx.Tuple3<T, A, B>>

parameters
as The a stream with which to zip 'this'.
bs The b stream with which to zip 'this' and as.
returns
A Tuple slice containing an element from each stream
Zips elements of supplied streams together and returns an Stream of Tuple3 containing the zipped elements. 1, 2, 3.zip(1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 3) == Tuple3[1, 1, 1], Tuple3[2, 2, 2], Tuple3[3, 3, 3]

zip4<A, B, C>(as : Stream<A>, bs : Stream<B>, cs : Stream<C>) : Stream<stx.Tuple4<T, A, B, C>>

parameters
as The a stream with which to zip 'this'.
bs The b stream with which to zip 'this' and as.
cs The c stream with which to zip 'this,' as, and bs.
returns
A Tuple slice containing one element from each stream
Zips elements of supplied streams together and returns an Stream of Tuple4 containing the zipped elements. For example see above

zip5<A, B, C, D>(as : Stream<A>, bs : Stream<B>, cs : Stream<C>, ds : Stream<D>) : Stream<stx.Tuple5<T, A, B, C, D>>

parameters
as The a stream with which to zip 'this'.
bs The b stream with which to zip 'this' and as.
cs The c stream with which to zip 'this,' as, and bs.
ds The d stream with which to zip 'this,' as, bs, and cs.
returns
A Tuple slice containing one element from each stream
Zips elements of supplied streams together and returns an Stream of Tuple5 containing the zipped elements. For example see above

zipWith<A, R>(as : Stream<A>, f : T -> A -> R) : Stream<R>

parameters
as The stream with which to zipWith 'this'.
f The function that will be used to get the result from the inputs streams ('this' and as).
returns
The Stream of the result of the application of the function on using both stream elements as input.
Zips elements of supplied streams together using a function and returns a Stream of the resulting elements. 1, 2, 3.zipWith(1, 2, 3, Tuples.t2) == Tuple2[1, 1], Tuple2[2, 2], Tuple2[3, 3]
